description: The Correctional Service Canada has a requirement to provide Physiotherapy Services to offenders at Grand Valley Institution for Women.
tags: Rehabilitation services, Physiotherapy, Correctional Service Canada EST Sorbey Shantyastonhi Lodge
full_summary:
# Physiotherapy Services Request for Proposal

The Correctional Service Canada is seeking proposals from qualified professionals to provide physiotherapy services to offenders at the Grand Valley Institution for Women.

## Summary of Proposal Requirements

* Provide physiotherapy services to offenders at the Grand Valley Institution for Women
* Deliverables include quality physiotherapy, related reports and findings, and documentation in Electronic Medical Records
* Initial contract period with up to 48 four-hour clinics

## Background

Correctional Service Canada (CSC) aims to implement primary health care and essential health services at all stages of an offender's sentence. This includes providing physiotherapy services in accordance with professional health services standards and the College of Physiotherapists of Ontario professional practice standards.

## Contractual Details

* Reference Number: CB-755-80696181 (Amendment 5)
* Solicitation Number: 21465-27-4615666
* Publication Date: February 7, 2024
* Tender Closing Date: February 23, 2024 at 14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: March 1, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: February 28, 2027

## Contact Information

For any inquires or questions, please contact:
Danielle Murdoch
Email: [danielle.murdoch@csc-scc.gc.ca](mailto:danielle.murdoch@csc-scc.gc.ca)
Phone: (343) 422-4831

## Documentation

The documentation package includes:
- Request for Proposal documents in both English and French
- Amendment documents
- Registration application
- Physiotherapy Services guidelines (English and French)

## Tenders Documents

To access tender documents, please visit: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca](https://canadabuys.canada.ca)

Note:
* The tender closing date is February 23, 2024 at 14:00:00
* Late tenders will not be accepted
* It is the sole responsibility of the bidder to ensure their bid meets all requirements and deadlines
